gov.nasa.arc.mct.util
Class ColorScheme

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.util.ColorScheme

public class ColorScheme
extends java.lang.Object

Serves user-specified colors to MCT through the UIManager.

Color scheme constructor.

public ColorScheme(java.util.Properties properties)
Create a new color scheme from the provided properties.

Parameters:
properties - a set of key/value pairs indicated name / color
Method Detail

getColorSchemeFor

public ColorScheme getColorSchemeFor(java.lang.String prefix)
Get a color scheme of keys corresponding to the supplied prefix. If this ColorScheme has an entry "Thing.Panel.background", for instance, getColorSchemeFor("Thing") will return a scheme containing a corresponding "Panel.background" entry.

Parameters:
prefix - the base word for the new color scheme
Returns:
a new color scheme with prefixed entries promoted to a top level

callUnderColorScheme

public <T> T callUnderColorScheme(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> call)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Sets color settings in the UIManager and calls a supplied routine with those settings in place. Then returns the UIManager to its original state before returning the called items result.

Type Parameters:
T - - T type.
Parameters:
call - a Callable containing the desired behavior
Returns:
T the return value of the supplied call
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - as thrown by Callable

applyColorScheme

public void applyColorScheme()
Inserts all non-wildcard entries into the UIManager. Whereas callUnderColorScheme is available for short-term color scheme needs, this action will modify the color scheme for the remainder of execution.
